00001 ##########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements "fuzzy" real numbers (two are equal when they are "close enough")
00004 #
00005 
00006 package Value::Real;
00007 my $pkg = 'Value::Real';
00008 
00009 use strict; no strict "refs";
00010 our @ISA = qw(Value);
00011 
00012 #
00013 #  Check that the input is a real number or a formula
00014 #  or a string that evaluates to a number
00015 #
00016 sub new {
00017   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00018   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00019   my $x = shift; $x = [$x,@_] if scalar(@_) > 0;
00020   return $x->inContext($context) if Value::isReal($x);
00021   $x = [$x] unless ref($x) eq 'ARRAY';
00022   Value::Error("Can't convert ARRAY of length %d to %s",scalar(@{$x}),Value::showClass($self))
00023     unless (scalar(@{$x}) == 1);
00024   if (Value::matchNumber($x->[0])) {
00025     return $self->formula($x->[0]) if Value::isFormula($x->[0]);
00026     return (bless {data => $x, context=>$context}, $class);
00027   }
00028   $x = Value::makeValue($x->[0],context=>$context);
00029   return $x if Value::isRealNumber($x);
00030   Value::Error("Can't convert %s to %s",Value::showClass($x),Value::showClass($self));
00031 }
00032 
00033 #
00034 #  Check that result is a number
00035 #
00036 sub make {
00037   my $self = shift;
00038   my $n = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? $_[1] : $_[0]);
00039   return $self->SUPER::make(@_) unless $n eq "nan";
00040   Value::Error("Result is not a real number");
00041 }
00042 
00043 #
00044 #  Create a new formula from the number
00045 #
00046 sub formula {
00047   my $self = shift; my $value = shift;
00048   my $context = $self->context;
00049   $context->Package("Formula")->new($context,$value);
00050 }
00051 
00052 #
00053 #  Return the real number type
00054 #
00055 sub typeRef {return $Value::Type{number}}
00056 sub length {1}
00057 
00058 #
00059 #  return the real number
00060 #
00061 sub value {(shift)->{data}[0]}
00062 
00063 sub isZero {shift eq "0"}
00064 sub isOne {shift eq "1"}
00065 
00066 sub transferFlags {}

00070 #
00071 #  Binary operations
00072 #
00073 
00074 sub add {
00075   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00076   return $self->inherit($other)->make($l->{data}[0] + $r->{data}[0]);
00077 }
00078 
00079 sub sub {
00080   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00081   return $self->inherit($other)->make($l->{data}[0] - $r->{data}[0]);
00082 }
00083 
00084 sub mult {
00085   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00086   return $self->inherit($other)->make($l->{data}[0] * $r->{data}[0]);
00087 }
00088 
00089 sub div {
00090   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00091   Value::Error("Division by zero") if $r->{data}[0] == 0;
00092   return $self->inherit($other)->make($l->{data}[0] / $r->{data}[0]);
00093 }
00094 
00095 sub power {
00096   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00097   my $x = $l->{data}[0] ** $r->{data}[0];
00098   return $self->inherit($other)->make($x) unless $x eq 'nan';
00099   Value::Error("Can't raise a negative number to a non-integer power") if ($l->{data}[0] < 0);
00100   Value::Error("Result of exponention is not a number");
00101 }
00102 
00103 sub modulo {
00104   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00105   $l = $l->{data}[0]; $r = $r->{data}[0];
00106   return $self->inherit($other)->make(0) if $r == 0; # non-fuzzy check
00107   my $m = $l/$r;
00108   my $n = int($m); $n-- if $n > $m; # act as floor() rather than int()
00109   return $self->inherit($other)->make($l - $n*$r);
00110 }
00111 
00112 sub compare {
00113   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00114   #
00115   #  Handle periodic Reals
00116   #
00117   my $m = $self->getFlag("period");
00118   if (defined $m) {
00119     $l = $l->with(period=>undef);  # make sure tests below don't use period
00120     $r = $r->with(period=>undef);
00121     if ($self->getFlag("logPeriodic")) {
00122       return 1 if $l->value == 0 || $r->value == 0; # non-fuzzy checks
00123       $l = log($l); $r = log($r);
00124     }
00125     $m = $self->promote($m); my $m2 = $m/2;
00126     $m2 = 3*$m/2 if $m2 == -$l; # make sure we don't get zero tolerances accidentally
00127     return $l + (($l-$r+$m2) % $m) <=> $l + $m2; # tolerances appropriate to $l centered in $m
00128   }
00129 
00130   my ($a,$b) = ($l->{data}[0],$r->{data}[0]);
00131   if ($self->getFlag('useFuzzyReals')) {
00132     my $tolerance = $self->getFlag('tolerance');
00133     if ($self->getFlag('tolType') eq 'relative') {
00134       my $zeroLevel = $self->getFlag('zeroLevel');
00135       if (abs($a) < $zeroLevel || abs($b) < $zeroLevel) {
00136     $tolerance = $self->getFlag('zeroLevelTol');
00137       } else {
00138     $tolerance = $tolerance * abs($a);
00139       }
00140     }
00141     return 0 if abs($a-$b) < $tolerance;
00142   }
00143   return $a <=> $b;
00144 }

00152 sub neg  {my $self = shift; $self->make(-($self->{data}[0]))}

00154 sub log  {my $self = shift; $self->make(CORE::log($self->{data}[0]))}

00165 sub atan2 {
00166   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00167   return $self->inherit($other)->make(CORE::atan2($l->{data}[0],$r->{data}[0]));

00172 sub string {
00173   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift; my $prec = shift;
00174   my $n = $self->{data}[0];
00175   my $format = $self->getFlag("format",$equation->{format} ||
00176                     ($equation->{context} || $self->context)->{format}{number});
00177   if ($format) {
00178     $n = sprintf($format,$n);
00179     if ($format =~ m/#\s*$/) {$n =~ s/(\.\d*?)0*#$/$1/; $n =~ s/\.$//}
00180   }
00181   $n = uc($n); # force e notation to E
00182   $n = 0 if abs($n) < $self->getFlag('zeroLevelTol');
00183   $n = "(".$n.")" if ($n < 0 || $n =~ m/E/i) && defined($prec) && $prec >= 1;
00184   return $n;
00185 }
00186 
00187 sub TeX {
00188   my $n = (shift)->string(@_);
00189   $n =~ s/E\+?(-?)0*([^)]*)/\\times 10^{$1$2}/i; # convert E notation to x10^(...)
00190   return $n;
00191 }
